thread.title: High School Roundup: Michaud hat trick powers Hilltoppers
thread.title_full: High School Roundup: Michaud hat trick powers Hilltoppers

author: Staff Reports sports@fosters.com
title: High School Roundup: Michaud hat trick powers Hilltoppers
text: Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 10:32 PM Updated Oct 8, 2015 at 10:32 PM By Staff Reportssports@fosters.com Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 10:32 PM SOMERSWORTH — Hunter Michaud scored three goals and Nick Dalesio added a goal and an assist as the Somersworth High School boys soccer team blanked Berlin, 4-0, Thursday in Division III. Josh Pincince had an assist and Jimmy Dalesio made seven saves. The Hilltoppers (5-7-1) host Farmington next Wednesday. Seacoast Christian 13, Grace 3 SOUTH BERWICK, Maine — Caleb LaCroix scored four goals, and Jesse Towne and Ethan Bowker each added three as the Seacoast Christian Academy boys soccer team defeated Grace, 13-3. Jet Archer scored twice and Bella Tibbets also scored for Seacoast (8-2). Brandon Vachon made 12 saves. Seacoast will play a quarterfinal playoff game on Oct. 22. FIELD HOCKEY Marshwood 3, Windham 1 SOUTH BERWICK, Maine — The Marshwood field hockey team defeated Windham, 3-1, Thursday, in Southern Maine Class A. Taylor Gilbert, Hannah Costin and Claudia Folger scored for the Hawks (10-2-1). Elaine Bachelder assisted on Costin's goal. Shannon Giblin made one save. Lexi Tworkowski and Madi Paulin played well for Marshwood. The Hawks are at Thornton Academy on Tuesday. GOLF Evans, Adjutant make cut HANOVER — Dover's Eric Evans and Spaulding's Austin Adjutant made the cut for the Division I individual golf tournament Thursday at Hanover Country Club on the campus of Dartmouth College. Evans tied for 12th with an 11-over par 80 and Adjutant tied for 16th with an 83. Both advanced to Saturday's second and final round. Spaulding's Rick Creteau missed the cut by one stroke (84) and Dover's Nick Kurtz shot 92. GIRLS SOCCER Oyster River 2, Souhegan 1 (2 OTs) DURHAM — Claire Genes scored with 3:47 left in the second overtime to lift the Oyster River girls soccer team past Souhegan, 2-1, in Division II action Thursday. Genes also assisted on OR's first goal, scored by Grace Heine at 3:09, which gave the Bobcats a 1-0 lead. Souhegan knotted the score with a goal late in the second half. Emma Sourdif was the winning goalie for the Bobcats (11-1). OR plays at St. Thomas Tuesday. Souhegan is 7-5-1. Coe-Brown 3, Merrimack Valley 2 (OT) NORTHWOOD — Christen Gallant scored two goals and assisted on the game-winner in overtime by Kylie St. Francis as Coe-Brown beat Merrimack Valley, 3-2, in D-II girls soccer action Thursday. Kayci Serino played a strong game and added an assist for the Bears (4-9). Mackenzie Daly made 11 saves in goal. Alyssa Jenkins played well in the midfield. Coe-Brown hosts Pembroke Tuesday. MV is 2-8-2. By Staff Reports
